lines.content: Staring blankly at such a fine ceiling,
Its whiteness pure as milk from women’s breasts.
Pondering which of them ‘tis of the best.
A black widow walks across this moment,
I know in my bosom, we share common,
For its life lasts as long as mine dost do.
Watching this sight, it reminds me of life,
All of these things, I wish I couldst do them.
Instead I shall be ‘fraid I will soon die,
Much like I dost write in every poem.
What a beautiful ceiling this must be,
Have I yet mentioned that I have T.B.?
